{{BLP sources|date=June 2010}} {{Infobox person | image = | imagesize = 200px | caption = Rana Ranbir {{pufc|Rana-ranbir.jpg|log=2010 April 30}} | birth_name = Ranvir Singh | birth_date = | birth_place = | occupation = Actor, Comedian, Stage Artist | Origin = [[Punjab, India|Punjab]] | yearsactive = | spouse = }}
'''Rana Ranbir''' is an [[India]]n actor.
Ranbir received a postgraduate degree in theater and television. He went on to act in several [[Punjabi culture|Punjabi]] stage, radio and television productions. He has directed works including ''Aala Afsar'', and ''Mitti Da Moh'' Some of his stage shows are ''Loha Kutt'', ''Annay Nishanchi'' and ''Mirza Sahiba''. His radio shows include ''Kehar Singh Di Maut'' and ''[[Bhagwant Mann]]'', ''Naughty No. 1''. Apart from comedies on television, Ranbir has acted in serious TV productions like ''Chitta Lahoo'', and ''Parchavain''. In the late 2000s, he became anchor of [[Alpha ETC Punjabi|Zee Punjabi]]'s road show ''Excuse Me Please'' and ''Jugnu Mast Mast''.
He plays the comic role of house manager Khoji in director [[Manmohan Singh (director)|Manmohan Singh]]'s 2009 [[Cinema of Punjab|Punjabi film]] ''[[Munde U.K. De]]''.
==Filmography== * 2010 [[Kabaddi Once Again]] * 2010 [[Chhevan Dariya ( The Sixth River)]] * 2010 [[Ik Kudi Punjab Di]] * 2010 [[Chak Jawaana]] * 2010 [[Channa Sachi Muchi]]
